info.title: ICD-API
info.description: ICD-API is a REST API that allows programmatic access to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD)

get.summary: This endpoint returns basic information on the latest release of the ICD-11 Foundation together with the top level Foundation entities.

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description:
This is an optional parameter and if ignored, the API will return values from the latest released version of the Foundation.
            If provided, the API will respond using that particular release. The values are like 2019-04

schema.description:
This is an optional parameter and if ignored, the API will return values from the latest released version of the Foundation.
            If provided, the API will respond using that particular release. The values are like 2019-04

parameters.name: API-Version
parameters.description:
Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
ICD-API is multi-lingual. By changing this header, you may make the API respond in different languages
Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

get.summary: This endpoint provides you information on a specific ICD-11 foundation entity

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Numeric part at the end of the URI for an entity

schema.description: Numeric part at the end of the URI for an entity

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description:
This is an optional parameter and if ignored, the API will return values from the latest released version of the Foundation.
            If provided, the API will respond using that particular release. The values are like 2019-04

schema.description:
This is an optional parameter and if ignored, the API will return values from the latest released version of the Foundation.
            If provided, the API will respond using that particular release. The values are like 2019-04

parameters.name: API-Version
parameters.description:
Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.description:

Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

application/xml.example:
<string>{
  "@context": "http://id.who.int/icd/contexts/contextForFoundationEntity.json",
  "@id": "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/250688797",
  "parent": [
    "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/941543084",
    "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/135352227",
    "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/734592989"
  ],
  "child": [
    "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/2114593305"
  ],
  "browserUrl": "NA",
  "title": {
    "@language": "en",
    "@value": "Enterocolitis due to Clostridium difficile"
  },
  "synonym": [
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "Clostridium difficile diarrhoea"
      }
    },
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "colitis due to Clostridium difficile"
      }
    },
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "Clostridium difficile gastroenteritis"
      }
    },
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "Clostridial difficile colitis"
      }
    },
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "C diff colitis"
      }
    },
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "necrotizing enterocolitis due to clostricium difficile infection"
      }
    },
    {
      "label": {
        "@language": "en",
        "@value": "foodborne clostridium difficile infection"
      }
    }
  ],
  "definition": {
    "@language": "en",
    "@value": "A disease of the colon, caused by an infection with the gram-positive bacteria Clostridium difficile. This disease is characterized by colitis, diarrhoea, abdominal pain, and fever. Transmission is commonly by direct or indirect contact, or from a disturbance of the normal bacterial flora of the colon. Confirmation is by identification of Clostridium difficile in a faecal sample."
  }
}</string>

get.summary:
This endpoint is for searching the foundation component of the ICD-11. The search can be customized using the parameters as described. Search endpoint accepts both GET and POST requests. If the size of the request is too large, you may need to use POST
as HTTP GET has a size limit of 2K

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Text to be searched. Having the character % at the end will be regarded as a wild card for that word

schema.description: Text to be searched. Having the character % at the end will be regarded as a wild card for that word

parameters.name: subtreesFilter
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Comma separated list of URIs. If provided, the search will be performed on the entities provided and their descendants

schema.description: Optional parameter. Comma separated list of URIs. If provided, the search will be performed on the entities provided and their descendants

parameters.name: chapterFilter
parameters.description: Optional, comma or semicolon separated list of chapter codes eg:01;02;21 When provided, the search will be performed only on these chapters

schema.description: Optional, comma or semicolon separated list of chapter codes eg:01;02;21 When provided, the search will be performed only on these chapters

parameters.name: useFlexisearch
parameters.description:
Changes the search mode to flexible search.
            - In the regular search mode, the Coding Tool will only give you results that contain all of the words that you've used in your search. It accepts different variants or 
            synonyms of the words but essentially it searches for a result that contains all components of your search. Whereas in flexible search mode, the results do not have to 
            contain all of the words that are typed. It would still try to find the best matching phrase but there may be words in your search that are not matched at all
            - It is recommended to use flexible search only when regular search does not provide a result

schema.description:
Changes the search mode to flexible search.
            - In the regular search mode, the Coding Tool will only give you results that contain all of the words that you've used in your search. It accepts different variants or 
            synonyms of the words but essentially it searches for a result that contains all components of your search. Whereas in flexible search mode, the results do not have to 
            contain all of the words that are typed. It would still try to find the best matching phrase but there may be words in your search that are not matched at all
            - It is recommended to use flexible search only when regular search does not provide a result

parameters.name: flatResults
parameters.description:
Optional parameter. Default value false. If set to true the search result entities are provided in a nested data structure
            representing the ICD-11 hierarchy. Otherwise they are listed as flat list of matches

schema.description:
Optional parameter. Default value false. If set to true the search result entities are provided in a nested data structure
            representing the ICD-11 hierarchy. Otherwise they are listed as flat list of matches

parameters.name: propertiesToBeSearched
parameters.description: Optional. When not provided, the search is performed on the title, synonym and narrowerTerm properties of the entity.

schema.description: Optional. When not provided, the search is performed on the title, synonym and narrowerTerm properties of the entity.

The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

get.summary: This endpoint returns basic information on the released version of ICD-10 together with the chapters in it

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: The id for the release. For ICD-10, this is generally the year e.g. 2016

schema.description: The id for the release. For ICD-10, this is generally the year e.g. 2016

parameters.name: API-Version
parameters.description:
Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
ICD-API is multi-lingual. By changing this header, you may make the API respond in different languages
Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
ICD-API is multi-lingual. By changing this header, you may make the API respond in different languages
Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

get.summary: This endpoint return information on a residual linearization entity

parameters.name: linearizationname
parameters.description: Short name for the linearization. e.g. mms for ICD Mortality and Morbidity Statistics

schema.description: Short name for the linearization. e.g. mms for ICD Mortality and Morbidity Statistics

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: The id for the release. This is generally formatted like this: 2019-04

schema.description: The id for the release. This is generally formatted like this: 2019-04

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Numeric part at the end of the URI for an entity. For residual categories this number is the same as its parent but the residual categories also have other or unspecified at the end

schema.description: Numeric part at the end of the URI for an entity. For residual categories this number is the same as its parent but the residual categories also have other or unspecified at the end

parameters.name: residual
parameters.description:
For residual categories:
            - this could be 'other' for other specified residual category
            - or 'unspecified' for the unspecified residual category

schema.description:
For residual categories:
            - this could be 'other' for other specified residual category
            - or 'unspecified' for the unspecified residual category

parameters.name: API-Version
parameters.description:
Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
ICD-API is multi-lingual. By changing this header, you may make the API respond in different languages
Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

get.summary:
This endpoint allows looking up an entity from its code. For postcoordinated code combinations, it provides 
more information on the code combination such as which axes are used and what values do they have

parameters.name: linearizationname
parameters.description: Short name for the linearization. e.g. mms for ICD Mortality and Morbidity Statistics

schema.description: Short name for the linearization. e.g. mms for ICD Mortality and Morbidity Statistics

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: The id for the release. This is generally formatted like this: 2019-04

schema.description: The id for the release. This is generally formatted like this: 2019-04

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code or code combination that will be looked up. (The & and / characters need to be URL encoded)

schema.description: The code or code combination that will be looked up. (The & and / characters need to be URL encoded)

parameters.name: API-Version
parameters.description:
Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
ICD-API is multi-lingual. By changing this header, you may make the API respond in different languages
Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

get.summary:
This endpoint is for searching the linearization (such as MMS). The search can be customized using the parameters as described
Search endpoint accepts both GET and POST requests. If the size of the request is too large, you may need to use POST
as HTTP GET has a size limit of 2K

parameters.description: Text to be searched. Having the character % at the end will be regarded as a wild card for that word

schema.description: Text to be searched. Having the character % at the end will be regarded as a wild card for that word

parameters.name: subtreesFilter
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Comma separated list of URIs. If provided, the search will be performed on the entities provided and their descendants

schema.description: Optional parameter. Comma separated list of URIs. If provided, the search will be performed on the entities provided and their descendants

parameters.name: includeKeywordResult
parameters.description:
Optional parameter. Default false. 
            If set to true, the search result will also include keyword list 
            - if the last word provided is incomplete, keyword list includes all words that start with the incomplete word (word completion mode)
            - if the last word is complete, the keyword list will provide suggested additional words that could be added to the search query. (word suggestion mode)
            The behavior can be seen in the 1st column of the ICD-11 Coding Tool search results

            - if the last word is complete, the keyword list will provide suggested additional words that could be added to the search query. (word suggestion mode)
            The behavior can be seen in the 1st column of the ICD-11 Coding Tool search results

parameters.name: chapterFilter
parameters.description: Optional, comma or semicolon separated list of chapter codes eg:01;02;21 When provided, the search will be performed only on these chapters

schema.description: Optional, comma or semicolon separated list of chapter codes eg:01;02;21 When provided, the search will be performed only on these chapters

parameters.name: useFlexisearch
parameters.description:
Changes the search mode to flexible search.
            - In the regular search mode, the Coding Tool will only give you results that contain all of the words that you've used in your search. It accepts different variants or 
            synonyms of the words but essentially it searches for a result that contains all components of your search. Whereas in flexible search mode, the results do not have to 
            contain all of the words that are typed. It would still try to find the best matching phrase but there may be words in your search that are not matched at all
            - It is recommended to use flexible search only when regular search does not provide a result

parameters.name: flatResults
parameters.description:
Optional parameter. Default value false. If set to true the search result entities are provided in a nested data structure
            representing the ICD-11 hierarchy. Otherwise they are listed as flat list of matches

parameters.name: API-Version
parameters.description:
Version of the API. Values are like v1,v2.
 For example, if you provide value v2, the API will respond in the format of the version 2 of the API

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
ICD-API is multi-lingual. By changing this header, you may make the API respond in different languages
Languages will be available as the translations of ICD-11 completes. 
The values are language codes such as en, es, zh, etc.

post.summary:
This endpoint is for searching the linearization (such as MMS). The search can be customized using the parameters as described
Search endpoint accepts both GET and POST requests. If the size of the request is too large, you may need to use POST
as HTTP GET has a size limit of 2K

LanguageSpecificText.description: Language specific text as used in JSON-LD

releaseId.description: Release identifier for this particular release of the classification

browserUrl.description:
ICD Browser is a web site that allows users see the ICD in its hierarchical structure at the same time providing search and post-coordination features.
Browser URL property provides a direct link to the classification in the WHO's on-line ICD Browser.

TopLevel.description: Class representing top level foundation or linearization

foundationReference.description:
In some cases such as in exclusions or index terms, the term itself could be coming from another entity in the classification
In these cases foundationReference holds the foundation URI for that entity
Index terms generated from foundation entities that are not located in the linearization have this reference

linearizationReference.description:
In some cases such as in exclusions or index terms, the term itself could be coming from another entity in the classification
In these cases linearizationReference holds the linearization (or release) URI for that entity

Term.description: Class representing a term with language specific label and optional cross references

child.description: List of URIs for the child entities

parent.description: List of URIs for the parent entities

synonym.description: List of synonyms for this entity

narrowerTerm.description: List of narrower terms for this entity

inclusion.description: List of inclusions for this entity

exclusion.description: List of exclusions for this entity

browserUrl.description:
ICD Browser is a web site that allows users see the ICD in its hierarchical structure at the same time providing search and post-coordination features.
Browser URL property provides a direct link to the classification in the WHO's on-line ICD Browser.

label.description: Label that matches the search query. The matched part of the label has a special markup for highlighting. For example when searched for the cholera the Vibrio cholera will be like Vibrio cholera

score.description: Score of the match for this particular property value

important.description: Identifies a very good match. The result matches all words from the search query.

ISimplePropertyValue.description: Represents PropertyValues returned in the search result

EntityTypeEnum.description:
Real (0): real entity in the linearization / foundation
UnderShoreLine (1): Entity in the foundation that can be represented as a post-coordination combination in the linearization
PostCoordinationCombination (2): does not exist in the foundation but can be represented as post-coordination combination

title.description: Title of the Entity. The matched part of the title has a special markup for highlighting. For example when searched for the cholera the title Vibrio cholera will be like Vibrio cholera

stemId.description: If the search result is composed of multiple URIs (i.e. postcoordinated result), Stem Id contains the URI of the stem code

isLeaf.description: Shows whether the entity is a leaf node (i.e. does not have any children)

hasCodingNote.description: Shows whether there is a coding note attached to the item

hasMaternalChapterLink.description: Shows whether the entity has maternal chapter link

matchingPVs.description: List of property values that match the search string

propertiesTruncated.description: Shows if the list of matching property values is truncated as a result of too many maching property values

isResidualOther.description: Shows if this entity is an other specified residual category. (Not applicable for foundation search )

isResidualUnspecified.description: Shows if this entity is an unspecified residual category. (Not applicable for foundation search )

chapter.description: The chapter code for the entity

theCode.description: The code for the entity (Not applicable for foundation )

score.description: Shows how good is the search result. Higher numbers are better matches. There is no other meaning to this value than its relative value

titleIsASearchResult.description: Shows whether the title of the entity is among the search results

titleIsTopScore.description: Shows whether the title is the top scored search result

important.description: Identifies a very good match. The result matches all words from the search query.

descendants.description: Used when the search result is not represented as flat list but rather organized according to ICD hierarchy

ISimpleEntity.description: SimpleEntity class represents a single ICD Entity in a search result

GuessWord.description: Represents a keyword returned as a as a word completion suggestion or as a next word suggestion

destinationEntities.description: List of entities that match the search query

error.description: Returns true if an error is occurred during the search

errorMessage.description: Error message if there was an error

resultChopped.description: If the search matches too many results, then the result is chopped

wordSuggestionsChopped.description: Shows if the word suggestion list is chopped as a result of too many matching words.

words.description: List of word suggestions if the search had includeKeywordResult parameter set to true

ISearchResult.description: Represents the search result. The search result is organized by ICD entities and in each entity we provide matching property values

latestRelease.description: Latest release available for this linearization

release.description: List of available releases for this linearization

MultiVersion.description:
Class representing available versions of a given classification or classification entity
This is used when the request is made without a relase id (or minor version)

@id.description: unique id for this linearization entity (URI)

source.description: URI of the foundation entity that this entity is derived from

classKind.description:
Class kind for the category. It could be one of the following
- chapter : if the entity is a chapter. (i.e. at the top level of the classification
- block : huger level entity which don't have codes
- category : An ICD entity that bears a code

child.description: List of URIs for the child entities

parent.description: List of URIs for the parent entity

indexTerm.description:
ICD-11 Index terms are generated from the terms (titles, inclusions, narrower terms) included in the entity
as well as from the foundation entities under the linearization shore line. The IndexTerm property includes 
all of the index terms of a linearization entity in one place.

inclusion.description: List of inclusions for this entity

exclusion.description: List of exclusions for this entity

browserUrl.description:
ICD Browser is a web site that allows users see the ICD in its hierarchical structure at the same time providing search and post-coordination features.
Browser URL property provides a direct link to the classification in the WHO's on-line ICD Browser.

@id.description: A unique id for for the entity and postcoordination axis combination

axisName.description: postcoordination axis name (a URI that uniquely identifies the axis)

requiredPostcoordination.description: If the post-coordination is required or just allowed. true means it is a required postcoordination

allowMultipleValues.description:
Shows the behaviour of the postcoordination
- 'AllowAlways' means the user could post-coordinate multiple times using this axis.
- 'NotAllowed' means the user only post-coordinate once using this axis
- 'AllowedExceptFromSameBlock' means multiple values are allowed only if they are coming from different blocks within the value set

scaleEntity.description:
List of allowed values during postcoordination. 
Note that these are hierarchical starting points of the allowed value set. i.e. any descendant of the entities provided under the 
`scaleEntity` property can be used during postcoordination.

PostcoordinationScaleInfo.description:
This class contains information on which axes allow or require postcoordination for an entity 
together with the valueset that could be used for the postcoordination

@id.description: unique id for this linearization entity (URI)

source.description: URI of the foundation entity that this entity is derived from

blockId.description: Block id for the block (only applicable to the blocks (groupings). e.g. BlockL2-1A0

codeRange.description: Code range for the block (only applicable to the blocks (groupings) e.g. 1A00-1A0Z

classKind.description:
Class kind for the category. It could be one of the following
- chapter : if the entity is a chapter. (i.e. at the top level of the classification
- block : higher level entity which don't have codes
- category : An ICD entity that bears a code
- window : A special type of grouping which don;t have children underneath but just foundationChildElsewhere

child.description: List of URIs for the child entities

parent.description: List of URIs for the parent entity

foundationChildElsewhere.description:
ICD-11 Foundation allows multiple parenting which means a category could be located in more than place in 
the foundation component. However, this is not possible for ICD-11 linearizations such as in ICD-11 MMS 
in which a category must be located at a single location. When looking at a linearization entity, this 
property would list the foundation children that are not children in the linearization.

indexTerm.description:
ICD-11 Index terms are generated from the terms (titles, inclusions, narrower terms) included in the entity
as well as from the foundation entities under the linearization shore line. The IndexTerm property includes 
all of the index terms of a linearization entity in one place.

inclusion.description: List of inclusions for this entity

exclusion.description: List of exclusions for this entity

postcoordinationScale.description:
Contains information on which axes allows or requires postcoordination for an entity 
together with the value set that could be used for the postcoordination

browserUrl.description:
ICD Browser is a web site that allows users see the ICD in its hierarchical structure at the same time providing search and post-coordination features.
Browser URL property provides a direct link to the classification in the WHO's on-line ICD Browser.

LinearizationEntity.description: Class representing a linearization entity such as a category in the MMS.

@id.description: unique id for this linearization entity (URI)

stemCode.description: Code of the stem. i.e. the first code that is postcoordinated

simplifiedCode.description:
In some cases the requested postcoordination combination may be simplified. In these cases, the simplifiedCode field contains
the code after simplification.

CodeInfo.description:
This class is used when an ICD-11 linearization queried with a code or a postcoordination code cluster
It provides information on the entities referred in the code string
